sources.description: Mystery and Imagination is a British television anthology series of classic horror and supernatural dramas. Five series were broadcast from 1966 to 1970 by the ITV network and produced by ABC and (later) Thames Television. The series featured television plays based on the works of well-known authors such as Robert Louis Stevenson, Bram Stoker, Mary Shelley, M. R. James, and Edgar Allan Poe. Only series 5 was filmed in colour.

metadata.Plot: A film-and-music interpretation of the Gothic poetry and short stories of Edgar Allan Poe. A unique musical suite into an accessible music film combing CGI, real-world imagery and live performance. During the film the musicians talk about Poe, music, life and death.
